test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS accurately measures and records temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with ±0.5°C accuracy.

test_steps.action: Set up reference temperature source at -80°C and allow to stabilize.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature reading within -80.5°C to -79.5°C.

test_steps.action: Repeat test at +50°C using reference temperature source.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature reading within +49.5°C to +50.5°C.

test_steps.action: Verify temperature recording interval in system logs.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature readings are recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of reference values
Recording interval does not exceed 5 minutes
regulatory_basis: EU GMP Annex 11 for computerized systems
data_integrity_requirements: Temperature data must be complete and accurate

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system correctly generates alarms when temperature deviates ±2°C from setpoint and integrates with paging system.

test_steps.action: Set temperature setpoint to 20°C and configure alarm thresholds at ±2°C.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts configuration without errors.

test_steps.action: Simulate temperature rise to 22.1°C using test equipment.
test_steps.expected_result: System generates audible/visual alarm within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Verify paging system receives alarm notification.
test_steps.expected_result: Paging system displays correct alarm message within 60 seconds.

test_steps.action: Repeat test for low temperature deviation (17.9°C).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates appropriate alarm and paging notification.

acceptance_criteria: Alarms generated within 30 seconds of deviation
Paging notifications received within 60 seconds
Correct alarm messages displayed
regulatory_basis: EU GMP Annex 11 for alarm management
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm records must be complete and unaltered
Audit trail must record all alarm events

test_cases.test_name: Verify Temperature Monitoring Accuracy and Alarm Generation
test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS accurately monitors temperature and generates alarms when deviations occur.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C in the EMS software.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays the setpoint as 25°C.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature increase to 27.5°C using a temperature simulator.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alarm indicating a temperature deviation.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature decrease to 22.5°C using a temperature simulator.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alarm indicating a temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: EMS accurately monitors temperature
Alarms are generated for deviations ±2°C from setpoint
data_integrity_requirements: Temperature data must be accurate and unaltered

test_cases.test_name: Verify Data Storage and Retention Compliance
test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS stores and retains data in compliance with regulatory requirements.

test_steps.action: Generate temperature data for a 24-hour period.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS records temperature data at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.

test_steps.action: Verify the data is stored in the vendor's standard database format.
test_steps.expected_result: Data is stored in the correct format and accessible.

test_steps.action: Check the archival feature to ensure data retention for 7 years.
test_steps.expected_result: Data is retained and can be retrieved from the archive.

acceptance_criteria: Data is recorded at intervals ≤5 minutes
Data is stored in vendor's standard format
Data is retained for 7 years
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be unaltered and retained for 7 years

test_cases.objective: To verify that the system accurately monitors temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature sensor to a known value within the range of -80°C to +50°C.
test_steps.expected_result: The system should display the temperature within ±0.5°C of the set value.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of the set value
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be accurate and consistent

test_cases.objective: To validate that alarm notifications are correctly integrated with the site paging system using the vendor API.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: An alarm notification should be sent to the site paging system via the vendor API.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications are successfully sent to the site paging system
data_integrity_requirements: Notifications must be timely and accurate

test_cases.test_name: Integration Test: Alarm Notification with Paging System
test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS correctly integrates with the site paging system to send alarm notifications using the vendor's API.
prerequisites: Site paging system configured and ready

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation exceeding ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS generates an alarm condition.

test_steps.action: Check the site paging system for the alarm notification.
test_steps.expected_result: The alarm notification is received on the paging system within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications are successfully sent to the paging system within the specified response time.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alarm notifications are logged and timestamped accurately.

test_cases.test_name: Performance Test: System Response Time for Alarm Conditions
test_cases.objective: Validate that the EMS responds to alarm conditions within the specified 30-second timeframe.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation exceeding ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS generates an alarm condition.

test_steps.action: Measure the time taken from alarm generation to system response.
test_steps.expected_result: The system response time does not exceed 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: The EMS responds to alarm conditions within 30 seconds.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alarm responses are logged and timestamped accurately.

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system correctly generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 20°C in the system configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts the setpoint and displays it correctly.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 22.1°C (exceeding +2°C deviation).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 17.9°C (exceeding -2°C deviation).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts are generated for both +2°C and -2°C deviations
Alerts are generated within 30 seconds of deviation
Alert messages are clear and actionable
data_integrity_requirements: Alert data must be stored in the vendor's standard database format

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system correctly retains and archives data for the required 7-year period.
prerequisites: Historical data exists in the system

test_steps.action: Generate test data with timestamps spanning 7 years in the past.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts and stores the test data.

test_steps.action: Access the vendor's archival feature to retrieve 7-year-old data.
test_steps.expected_result: System successfully retrieves the archived data without corruption.

test_steps.action: Verify the audit trail for the archived data.
test_steps.expected_result: Complete audit trail exists for all archived data.

acceptance_criteria: Data older than 7 years is accessible through archival feature
Retrieved data matches original records without corruption
Complete audit trail exists for all archived data
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be retained for 7 years
Audit trail must be maintained for all data
